result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L. Yunk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Restitution added per Restitution Order filed 7/16/15.

Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Brandon L. Yunk in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Defendant Brandon L. Yunk in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Cases heard today are 14CF250, 14CF419, 14CF320, 14CF265, 14CF266 (sentencing), 15CF152 (Plea/Status) and 14CT281 (sentencing).

1:35 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.

15CF152:
PLEA HEARING -
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2 - Guilty
Count 3 - Guilty
Count 4 - DRI
Count 5 - DRI
Count 6 - DRI
Count 7 - DRI
Count 8 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Court takes a moment to review the criminal complaint.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count's 1, 2, 3 & 8 and Count's 4-7 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

SENTENCING HEARING:
Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI and ATTIC Report.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Molepske states a correction on the PSI and states the correction on the record.
Atty Arendt is in agreement with Atty Molepske and Atty Arendt states that he had not received a copy of the ATTIC Report (a copy will be provided to the Attorney for the Defendant to review prior to the sentencing).
Court inform's the representative of the DOC makes that correction as stated on the record on the PSI.
Counsel for the defendant has had ample opportunity to review the PSI and ATTIC Report with his client.
Victim notification had been completed but no victim's appear in Court today to make a statement.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing and states his recommendations on the record.
2:27 p.m.  Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing and states his recommendations on the record.
Defendant makes statements prior to sentencing.

Attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt in court.  Defendant Brandon Yunk not in Court.  Victim Witness Coordinator, Jane Iwanski in Court along with Victim Alicia Olszewski  in Court.

10:29a.m.  Court calls case and states appearances for the record.

10:30a.m.  Victim Alicia Olszewski is sworn in.
Victim makes statements to the Court.
Court questions Victim.
Victim makes further statements to the Court.

Victim provides documents to the Court for review.
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of the Victim.

Atty Arendt questions Victim.
Victim makes statements to the Court.

Atty Arendt reviews documents provided.
Atty Arendt continues to question Victim.
Victim makes statements to the Court.

Victim Witness Coordinator makes statements to the Court.
Atty Arendt makes statements to the Court.
Exhibit #2 is marked on behalf of the Witness.
Atty Arendt questions the Witness.
Witness makes statements to the Court.

Atty Arendt makes final statements to the Court.

Court questions Victim.
Victim Witness Coordinator makes statements to the Court.
Atty Arendt makes statement to the Court.

Victim Witness Coordinator questions the Court.

Court again questions Victim.
Victim makes statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT;
Court will issue a written determination.

FTR:  10:44a.m.
Sentencing hearing on May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon L. Yunk in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 
14CT281 Ct 1: OWI 2nd:  Guidlines .027%: 28 days jail, $1,568.00, 16 mo Revocation of license and 16 mo IID, AODA/DOT assessment
14CT281 Ct 2: to be dismissed.
14CT281 Ct 3: OAR: $100 + costs, Zero days jail and Zero days suspension

PSI requested the following:
14CF265: W/H Sentence: 5 yr Probation, Restitution $598.40 to BP gas station.
14CF250: 60 days jail, consecutive to any other sentences. $300 fine.
14CF266: Ct 1: I/S Sentence: Prison: 3 yr In+ 5 yr Es
14CF266: Ct 2 to be DRI
14CF320: Ct 1, 3, & 4: I/S Sentence: Prison: 18 mo In + 60 mo Es, concurrent to each other, but consecutive to 14CF266. Restitution $2,732.93.
14CF320: Cts 2, 5, & 6 to be DRI.
14CF419: I/S Sentence: Prison: 18 mo In + 18 Es, concurrent with 14CF320, but consecutive to 14CF266.
14CM279: to be DRI
14FO707: UAD to be dismissed
14TR3040: License Restriction to be dismissed

Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 
14CT281 Ct 2: PAC%: No Contest
14CT281 Ct 3: OAR: No Contest
14CF250 Op Veh w/o Consent: No Contest

14CF265 Burglary: No Contest
14CF266 Burglary Ct 1: No Contest
14CF320 Op w/o Consent Ct 1: No Contest
14CF320 Bail Jump-fel Ct 3: No Contest
14CF320 Bail Jump-fel Ct 4: No Contest
14CF419 Bail Jump-fel: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 14CT281 Ct 2 (PAC%) & 3 (OAR); 14CF250, 14CF265, 14CF266 Ct 1, 14CF320 cts 1, 3, & 4, and 14CF419.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 
14CF266 Ct 2, 14CF320 Cts 2, 5, & 6, 14CM279, 14FO707, and 14TR3040 are Dismissed and Read In.
14CT281 Ct 1: OWI 2nd is dismissed.


Bonds are revoked. (Court will not revoke bonds today)
Objection by Atty Arendt and informs the Court his client has been Day Reporting and complying and has ties to the community.
DA Molepski concurs that parties are not requesting bond being revoked.
Court questions the parties for sentencing on 14CT281.

BY THE COURT:
PSI Reports ordered.
Sentencing date parties are to get from JA.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
